candidates.title: release: prepare for v0.4.0
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Version 0.4.0 release with backend abstraction layer and repository pattern architecture
  * File-based SQLite database support
  * UI enhancements
  * Matrix channel support
  * AUR package availability

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Fixed accented character handling
  * Fixed sync ordering
  * Fixed default project refresh
  * Fixed task-label relationships
  * Fixed scrollbar calculations and sidebar interactions

<sub>✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.</sub>

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: Bump tokio from 1.47.1 to 1.48.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update rust code

candidates.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.47.1 to 1.48.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.48.0

1.48.0 (October 14th, 2025)

The MSRV is increased to 1.71.

Added

  • fs: add File::max_buf_size (#7594)
  • io: export Chain of AsyncReadExt::chain (#7599)
  • net: add SocketAddr::as_abstract_name (#7491)
  • net: add TcpStream::quickack and TcpStream::set_quickack (#7490)
  • net: implement AsRef<Self> for TcpStream and UnixStream (#7573)
  • task: add LocalKey::try_get (#7666)
  • task: implement Ord for task::Id (#7530)

Changed

  • deps: bump windows-sys to version 0.61 (#7645)
  • fs: preserve max_buf_size when cloning a File (#7593)
  • macros: suppress clippy::unwrap_in_result in #[tokio::main] (#7651)
  • net: remove PollEvented noise from Debug formats (#7675)
  • process: upgrade Command::spawn_with to use FnOnce (#7511)
  • sync: remove inner mutex in SetOnce (#7554)
  • sync: use UnsafeCell::get_mut in Mutex::get_mut and RwLock::get_mut (#7569)
  • time: reduce the generated code size of Timeout<T>::poll (#7535)

Fixed

  • macros: fix hygiene issue in join! and try_join! (#7638)
  • net: fix copy/paste errors in udp peek methods (#7604)
  • process: fix error when runtime is shut down on nightly-2025-10-12 (#7672)
  • runtime: use release ordering in wake_by_ref() even if already woken (#7622)
  • sync: close the broadcast::Sender in broadcast::Sender::new() (#7629)
  • sync: fix implementation of unused RwLock::try_* methods (#7587)

Unstable

  • tokio: use cargo features instead of --cfg flags for taskdump and io_uring (#7655, #7621)
  • fs: support io_uring in fs::write (#7567)
  • fs: support io_uring with File::open() (#7617)
  • fs: support io_uring with OpenOptions (#7321)
  • macros: add local runtime flavor (#7375, #7597)

Documented

  • io: clarify the zero capacity case of AsyncRead::poll_read (#7580)
  • io: fix typos in the docs of AsyncFd readiness guards (#7583)
  • net: clarify socket gets closed on drop (#7526)
  • net: clarify the behavior of UCred::pid() on Cygwin (#7611)
  • net: clarify the supported platform of set_reuseport() and reuseport() (#7628)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 556820f chore: prepare Tokio v1.48.0 (#7677)
  • fd1659a chore: prepare tokio-macros v2.6.0 (#7676)
  • 53e8aca ci: update nightly version to 2025-10-12 (#7670)
  • 9e5527d process: fix error when runtime is shut down on nightly-2025-10-12 (#7672)
  • 25a24de net: remove PollEvented noise from Debug formats (#7675)
  • c1fa25f task: clarify the behavior of several spawn_local methods (#7669)
  • e7e02fc fs: use FileOptions inside fs::File to support uring (#7617)
  • f7a7f62 ci: remove cargo-deny Unicode-DFS-2016 license exception config (#7619)
  • d1f1499 tokio: use cargo feature for taskdump support instead of cfg (#7655)
  • ad6f618 runtime: clarify the behavior of Handle::block_on (#7665)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=tokio&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=1.47.1&new-version=1.48.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

candidates.body:
Bumps [sea-orm](https://github.com/SeaQL/sea-orm) from 1.1.16 to 1.1.17.
Release notes

Sourced from sea-orm's releases.

1.1.17

New Features

  • Added map_sqlx_mysql_opts, map_sqlx_postgres_opts, map_sqlx_sqlite_opts to ConnectOptions SeaQL/sea-orm#2731
let mut opt = ConnectOptions::new(url);
opt.map_sqlx_postgres_opts(|pg_opt: PgConnectOptions| {
    pg_opt.ssl_mode(PgSslMode::Require)
});
  • Added mariadb-use-returning to use returning syntax for MariaDB SeaQL/sea-orm#2710
  • Released sea-orm-rocket 0.6 SeaQL/sea-orm#2732
Changelog

Sourced from sea-orm's changelog.

1.1.17 - pending

New Features

let mut opt = ConnectOptions::new(url);
opt.map_sqlx_postgres_opts(|pg_opt: PgConnectOptions| {
    pg_opt.ssl_mode(PgSslMode::Require)
});

candidates.title: Enhance/add backend entity
candidates.body:
Add Backend entities, since we intend to support multiple backends (multiple todoist accounts, and/or other backends like ticktick for instance)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Pluggable backend system with a built-in Todoist connector and persisted backend configurations.

- **Improvements**
  - Sync is backend-agnostic, using repository-based data access and robust mapping between remote and local items.
  - Multi-backend-ready syncing with improved conflict handling and composite keys for reliable mapping.
  - Added composite indexes for faster lookups and clearer startup timeout/error handling.

- **Chores**
  - Added async/async-trait and enhanced error-handling dependency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: Refactor: use our own uuids as PK
candidates.body:
this will be needed for the multi-backend coming-soon-ish implementation



<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- Refactor
  - App and storage unified around entity-backed models and UUID identifiers; UI, actions, and dialogs updated to use them.
- New Features
  - Batch upsert sync for faster, more reliable remote↔local synchronization; UI: inline help toggle and lightweight info messages.
- Bug Fixes
  - Improved consistency for parent/child links, label associations, and sync conflict handling.
- Tests
  - Removed legacy display-conversion unit tests.
- Chores
  - Switched ORM/dependencies and added explicit UUID dependency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

0.7.1 (2024-12-15)

  • Add syslog v7 support (thanks [@​BlackDex]!)

0.7.0 (2024-10-20)

candidates.title: Use log/fern for logging (#95)
candidates.body:
fixes #95 

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Centralized logging with optional file output and an in-app memory log you can view and clear (5000-entry retention).

- Refactor
  - Replaced per-component logger plumbing with a unified global logging approach; startup and service initialization simplified.
  - Logging calls migrated to the standard logging facility.

- Chores
  - Updated ignore rules: src/ and pkg/ are no longer automatically excluded.

- Tests
  - Test suite and examples updated to use the new module-level logging APIs and revised initialization pattern.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: chores: get ready for v0.3.0
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* New Features
  * Task Search with Search Dialog; Upcoming view; subtask creation; configuration file support; human‑readable dates with time; screenshot mode; debug database backend.
* Changed
  * Improved sidebar layout, task hierarchy display, checkbox UI; local-time date handling; enhanced logging.
* Bug Fixes
  * Deletion confirmations; reliable label storage; corrected Today view; safer resize behavior; restored date shortcuts.
* Removed
  * Soft task deletion, task reopening, migration mechanism, unused metadata.
* Documentation
  * Expanded and improved docs.
* Tests
  * Added unit tests.
* Chores
  * Version bumped to 0.3.0.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

labels.description: New feature or request

candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - TOML-based configuration with precedence (./terminalist.toml → ~/.config/terminalist/config.toml → defaults).
  - CLI flag --generate-config to create a default config file.
  - Configurable UI (mouse enable/disable, sidebar width, default project/view) and display options (descriptions, durations, labels, project colors).
  - Optional file-based logging controlled by config.

- **Documentation**
  - README and PRD updated with config usage, examples, and precedence.

- **Chores**
  - Added toml and dirs dependencies.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: Add various documentations for contributing
candidates.body: ## Summary This PR significantly enhances the project's developer experience, build reliability, and overall hygiene. It includes updates to documentation to reflect the current codebase, standardizes formatting, adds comprehensive contribution guidelines and templates, hardens the CI pipeline with MSRV pinning and OS matrix testing, enables automated dependency updates via Dependabot, and adds a `--version` flag to the CLI. ## Changes - [x] Code changes - [ ] Tests added/updated (smoke tests added to CI, but no new unit tests) - [x] Docs updated (README/CONTRIBUTING/CODE_OF_CONDUCT/PR/Issue templates) ## Checklist - [x] `cargo fmt` passes - [x] `cargo clippy -- -D warnings` passes - [x] `cargo test` passes ## Screenshots / Logs (if UI/behavioral change) N/A ## Related issues Fixes # --- ## Summary by CodeRabbit - **New Features** - Added CLI --version/-V output and updated help text. - **Documentation** - Expanded README (dependencies, project structure, dev workflow, roadmap). - Added CONTRIBUTING, CODE OF_CONDUCT, PR and issue templates, and updated product doc for Rust 1.78. - **Chores** - Repository formatting config and toolchain pinned to Rust 1.78; Cargo.lock now tracked. - CI/automation improved: multi-OS/toolchain matrix, MSRV build, caching, smoke tests, and Dependabot enabled.

- Bump wasi to version 0.14.6

These updates include various bug fixes and improvements across the dependencies.

candidates.title: Restore sectioning functionality and fix task dialog project selection
candidates.body:
## Summary
- Restores the sectioning functionality that was lost during the modular refactor
- Fixes task creation dialog to properly preselect and use current project
- Maintains the clean modular architecture with new TaskListItemType components

## Technical Changes
### ✅ Sectioning Restored
- **Today View**: Separates tasks into "⏰ Overdue" and "📅 Today" sections with separators
- **Tomorrow View**: Adds "📅 Tomorrow" header for all tasks
- **Upcoming View**: Groups tasks by date with formatted headers (e.g., "📊 Friday - Mar 15")  
- **Project View**: Groups tasks by project sections with proper separators
- **Label View**: Filtered hierarchical display for label-specific tasks

### ✅ Task Dialog Fixed  
- When viewing a specific project, task creation dialog now preselects that project
- User can change project selection via Tab, and submission correctly uses their choice
- Fixed submission logic to prioritize user selection over default preselection

### ✅ Code Improvements
- Created modular `TaskListItemType` enum with `Task`, `Header`, and `Separator` variants
- Implemented `ListItem` trait for consistent rendering interface
- Simplified render methods and removed redundant code
- Maintained all existing features: task descriptions, hierarchical display, etc.

## Test Plan
- [x] Compilation successful with no errors
- [x] All existing tests pass
- [x] Release build successful
- [x] Sectioning works across all view types (Today, Tomorrow, Upcoming, Project, Label)
- [x] Task dialog correctly preselects current project
- [x] Task dialog respects user's project selection changes
- [x] Hierarchical task display and descriptions preserved

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Redesigned task list with hierarchical items, section headers, and separators; richer per-item visual details (icons, priority badge, project tag, due date, badges, truncated description).

- Improvements
  - Unified item-based rendering for smoother browsing and selection mapping.
  - Streamlined navigation: Up/Down navigate selectable items; Enter/Space complete selection.
  - Updated shortcuts: a opens task creation honoring your selected project, Delete/d removes tasks.
  - Context-aware empty states for Today/Tomorrow/Projects.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

chosen_pr.title: Bump tokio from 1.47.1 to 1.48.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update rust code

chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.47.1 to 1.48.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.48.0

1.48.0 (October 14th, 2025)

The MSRV is increased to 1.71.

Added

  • fs: add File::max_buf_size (#7594)
  • io: export Chain of AsyncReadExt::chain (#7599)
  • net: add SocketAddr::as_abstract_name (#7491)
  • net: add TcpStream::quickack and TcpStream::set_quickack (#7490)
  • net: implement AsRef<Self> for TcpStream and UnixStream (#7573)
  • task: add LocalKey::try_get (#7666)
  • task: implement Ord for task::Id (#7530)

Changed

  • deps: bump windows-sys to version 0.61 (#7645)
  • fs: preserve max_buf_size when cloning a File (#7593)
  • macros: suppress clippy::unwrap_in_result in #[tokio::main] (#7651)
  • net: remove PollEvented noise from Debug formats (#7675)
  • process: upgrade Command::spawn_with to use FnOnce (#7511)
  • sync: remove inner mutex in SetOnce (#7554)
  • sync: use UnsafeCell::get_mut in Mutex::get_mut and RwLock::get_mut (#7569)
  • time: reduce the generated code size of Timeout<T>::poll (#7535)

Fixed

  • macros: fix hygiene issue in join! and try_join! (#7638)
  • net: fix copy/paste errors in udp peek methods (#7604)
  • process: fix error when runtime is shut down on nightly-2025-10-12 (#7672)
  • runtime: use release ordering in wake_by_ref() even if already woken (#7622)
  • sync: close the broadcast::Sender in broadcast::Sender::new() (#7629)
  • sync: fix implementation of unused RwLock::try_* methods (#7587)

Unstable

  • tokio: use cargo features instead of --cfg flags for taskdump and io_uring (#7655, #7621)
  • fs: support io_uring in fs::write (#7567)
  • fs: support io_uring with File::open() (#7617)
  • fs: support io_uring with OpenOptions (#7321)
  • macros: add local runtime flavor (#7375, #7597)

Documented

  • io: clarify the zero capacity case of AsyncRead::poll_read (#7580)
  • io: fix typos in the docs of AsyncFd readiness guards (#7583)
  • net: clarify socket gets closed on drop (#7526)
  • net: clarify the behavior of UCred::pid() on Cygwin (#7611)
  • net: clarify the supported platform of set_reuseport() and reuseport() (#7628)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 556820f chore: prepare Tokio v1.48.0 (#7677)
  • fd1659a chore: prepare tokio-macros v2.6.0 (#7676)
  • 53e8aca ci: update nightly version to 2025-10-12 (#7670)
  • 9e5527d process: fix error when runtime is shut down on nightly-2025-10-12 (#7672)
  • 25a24de net: remove PollEvented noise from Debug formats (#7675)
  • c1fa25f task: clarify the behavior of several spawn_local methods (#7669)
  • e7e02fc fs: use FileOptions inside fs::File to support uring (#7617)
  • f7a7f62 ci: remove cargo-deny Unicode-DFS-2016 license exception config (#7619)
  • d1f1499 tokio: use cargo feature for taskdump support instead of cfg (#7655)
  • ad6f618 runtime: clarify the behavior of Handle::block_on (#7665)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=tokio&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=1.47.1&new-version=1.48.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

  • net: fix copy/paste errors in udp peek methods (#7604)

  • runtime: use release ordering in wake_by_ref() even if already woken (#7622)
  • sync: close the broadcast::Sender in broadcast::Sender::new() (#7629)
  • sync: fix implementation of unused RwLock::try_* methods (#7587)

Unstable

  • tokio: use cargo features instead of --cfg flags for taskdump and io_uring (#7655, #7621)
  • fs: support io_uring in fs::write (#7567)
  • fs: support io_uring with File::open() (#7617)
  • fs: support io_uring with OpenOptions (#7321)
  • macros: add local runtime flavor (#7375, #7597)

Documented

  • io: clarify the zero capacity case of AsyncRead::poll_read (#7580)
  • io: fix typos in the docs of AsyncFd readiness guards (#7583)
  • net: clarify socket gets closed on drop (#7526)
  • net: clarify the behavior of UCred::pid() on Cygwin (#7611)
  • net: clarify the supported platform of set_reuseport() and reuseport() (#7628)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 556820f chore: prepare Tokio v1.48.0 (#7677)
  • fd1659a chore: prepare tokio-macros v2.6.0 (#7676)

  • 9e5527d process: fix error when runtime is shut down on nightly-2025-10-12 (#7672)
  • 25a24de net: remove PollEvented noise from Debug formats (#7675)
  • c1fa25f task: clarify the behavior of several spawn_local methods (#7669)
  • e7e02fc fs: use FileOptions inside fs::File to support uring (#7617)
  • f7a7f62 ci: remove cargo-deny Unicode-DFS-2016 license exception config (#7619)

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
